definition: fortified hill village/mountain stronghold (esp. of bandits)/(fig.) knockoff (goods)/counterfeit/imitation
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: And David was then in an hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 那时大卫在山寨，非利士人的防营在伯利恒。

sentences.english: Now Kring is back on the same property, in a picture-perfect cottage.
sentences.chinese: 现在Kring是对同一财产，在一个完美的山寨。

sentences.english: To choose the catchword of 2008, Simulated Culture must be included.
sentences.chinese: 评选2008年流行语，“山寨”当有一席之地。

sentences.english: Copycatting Culture is largely emerging on the internet, and should we follow or force it our?
sentences.chinese: 当“山寨文化”风行网络，我们是追捧还是打杀？

sentences.english: Like so much else in China, themeaning of shanzhai is undergoing a drastic change.
sentences.chinese: 就像其他正在中国发生的事情，山寨正经历着巨变。

sentences.english: Simulated Culture is largely emerging on the internet, and should we follow or force it our?
sentences.chinese: 当“山寨文化”风行网络，我们是追捧还是打杀？

sentences.english: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.
sentences.chinese: 那时大卫在山寨，非利士人的防营在伯利恒。

sentences.english: The bandits withdrew to their mountain fastness for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 盗匪们撤回到他们的山寨中准备过冬。

sentences.english: For some mainland commentators, shanzhai is a dirty word.
sentences.chinese: 对一些大陆评论人士来说，“山寨”乃鄙俗之词。

sentences.english: Innovation is overrated. It's time to appreciate the power of the copycat.
sentences.chinese: 请勿过于高看创新，是时候正视山寨的力量了。

sentences.english: Instead of being simple fakes, the phones are more akin to a customised car.
sentences.chinese: 与简单的伪造品相比，山寨机更像是定制轿车。

sentences.english: China still suffers from its reputation of being a copycat manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 中国仍然受累于“山寨”仿造品制造者的声誉。

sentences.english: Will 2011 be the year of the copycat?
And David went up from there and lived in the strongholds of En Gedi.
sentences.chinese: 大卫从那里上去，住在隐基底的山寨里。

sentences.english: But the prophet Gad said to David, "Do not stay in the stronghold. Go into the land of Judah."
sentences.chinese: 先知迦得对大卫说，你不要住在山寨，要往犹大地去。

sentences.english: And the prophet Gad said unto David, Abide not in the hold; depart, and get thee into the land of Judah.
sentences.chinese: 先知迦得对大卫说，你不要住在山寨，要往犹大地去。

definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
Celestial Empire, tributary title conferred on imperial China/Taiping Heavenly Kingdom
navy (archaic)/person employed to post messages on the Internet (abbr. for 網絡水軍|网络水军[Wang3 luo4 shui3 jun1])
